definition: to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: House of flowers may have been a calamity, was it frustrating branches off Whispering.
sentences.chinese: 院中的花草可遭了殃，被它折腾的枝折花落。

sentences.english: Stop messing about – finish your work first.
sentences.chinese: 别瞎折腾了，先干完你的工作。

sentences.english: I'm very suspicious of a man who fusses much with his hair.
sentences.chinese: 我对于一个为了头发折腾个没完的人是颇感纳罕的。

sentences.english: The net effect is that you wind up with a much better proportioned working space.
sentences.chinese: 总的效果是你折腾出一个更符合比例的工作空间。

sentences.english: I should not toss approximately pupils of same master.
Learn the proper way to toss the birds in this free animal care video.
sentences.chinese: 学习正确的方法来折腾在这个自由的鸟动物护理视频。

sentences.english: After two day-long of tossing about, the question solves finally.
sentences.chinese: 经过两天的折腾，问题终于解决。

sentences.english: I just don't have time for this.
sentences.chinese: 我没时间在这儿瞎折腾了。

sentences.english: The festering wound has plagued me for several days.
sentences.chinese: 化脓的伤口已经折腾我好几天了。

sentences.english: I dont like Zheteng, but i will defend to the death your right to Zheteng.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢折腾，但我愿意誓死捍卫你折腾的权利。

sentences.english: I dont like Zheteng, but i will defend to the death your right to Zheteng.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢折腾，但我愿意誓死捍卫你折腾的权利。

sentences.english: Lord knows I've never seen a baby keep its mammy so sick as much as this one has.
sentences.chinese: 老天啊，我以前从来没见过象这样折腾妈妈的宝宝。

sentences.english: You are so restless. You've moved houses twice in six months.
sentences.chinese: 你可真能折腾，半年搬了两次家。

sentences.english: Time spent agonizing over them is time wasted.
sentences.chinese: 把时间折腾在这上面，是浪费时间。

sentences.english: The short three-kilometer drive to the village has taken a total of three hours.
sentences.chinese: 从山路到村口不过三公里路，却折腾了整整三个小时。

sentences.english: I can't. These high-heels are killing me.
sentences.chinese: 我没办法，这双高跟鞋快把我折腾死了。

definition: to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
to move/to shift/to exchange/to buy and sell/peddling
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of

to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
